title: v0.2.0_1 is 10% slower than v0.1.12_2, why?
body_html:
I have benchmark tested v0.2.0_1 vs v0.1.12_2 using OpenNMT, https://github.com/OpenNMT/OpenNMT-py

For training, on exactly the same data, same model size, same total number of parameters, etc., v0.2.0_1 uses 10% more time than v0.1.12_2.

I hope you guys be aware of performance drop when implementing new features.

Any ideas, thanks!

For training, on exactly the same data, same model size, same total number of parameters, etc., v0.2.0_1 uses 10% more time than v0.1.12_2.

I hope you guys be aware of performance drop when implementing new features.
